required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigate the Effect of AZD1305 on Patients With Left Ventricular Dysfunction
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-centre, Single-blind, Randomised, Placebo-controlled Phase IIa Study to Investigate the Effect of AZD1305 Given as an Intravenous (iv) Infusion on Left Ventricular Performance in Patients With Left Ventricular Dysfunction

brief_summary.textblock: To explore if AZD1305 compromises left ventricular performance in patients with left ventricular dysfunction

primary_outcome.measure: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF), Change From Baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the iv loading dose during 30 min and the following maintenance iv dose during a maximum of 90 min. The infusion was stopped when all echocardiographic measurements had been carried out
primary_outcome.description: To explore if AZD1305 compromises left ventricular performance in patients with left ventricular dysfunction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With at Least One Reported Adverse Event During Each Study Period and in Each Dose Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomisation to last study visit (mean infusion time 1.6 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the tolerability and safety of AZD1305 given as an iv infusion to patients with left ventricular dysfunction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under Curve (AUC) ( µmol*h/L) of AZD1305
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the iv loading dose during 30 min and the following maintenance iv dose during a maximum of 90 min.
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the pharmacokinetics of AZD1305, given as an iv infusion, in patients with left ventricular dysfunction

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hours following start of IV dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum QTcF observed for each patient. QTcF is the QT interval corrected for the RR interval using the Fridericia formula

intervention.description: iv single infusion: initial iv loading dose which will be followed by a maintenance dose given for a maximum of 90 minutes
iv single infusion: initial iv loading dose which will be followed by a maintenance dose given for a maximum of 90 minutes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male patients and postmenopausal women
- Mildly/moderately decreased heart function
- Regular heart rhythm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Potassium outside normal reference values
- Child bearing potential
- Severely decreased heart function

overall_official.affiliation: AstraZeneca, Clinical Pharmacology Unit at Sahlgrenska University Hospital, Sweden

responsible_party.name_title: Helen Lunde, MD, Medical Science Director, Emerging Arrhythmia and Lipids

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study enrolled 33 patients and randomised 16 patients between August 2008 and July 2009 at a Clinical Pharmacology Unit located at a University Hospital in Sweden.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Screening for eligibility and no significant changes in the medication for heart failure during the preceding 1 month before enrolment. In addition, patients for whom it was not possible to obtain high quality echocardiographic pictures were excluded from the study. The pre-entry visit was 30 days or less before the first dosing visit.

group.title: AZD1305 Dose 1 and Dose 2
group.description: AZD1305 was given as an initial intravenous (iv) loading dose during 30 min followed by a maintenance iv dose during a maximum of 90 min. The infusion was stopped when all echocardiographic measurements had been carried out. The mean total dose of AZD1305 was 30 mg (range 29-31 mg)

group.title: Placebo Dose 1 and Dose 2
group.description: Sodium chloride was given as an initial iv loading dose during 30 min followed by a maintenance iv dose during a maximum of 90 min. The infusion was stopped when all echocardiographic measurements had been carried out

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PI was employed at AstraZeneca and had therefore to follow AZ policy.
